This post is to document where we are with Shared Parental Leave in England at the moment and explain it a little more to people who are thinking about taking it.

```{r infographic, echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, fig.width=6, fig.height=3}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)

df <- tibble(
  option = c("Option 1", 
             "Option 2", "Option 2",
             "Option 3", "Option 3"),
  person = c("Mum", 
             "Both parents", "Paid childcare",
             "Mum", "Dad"),
  value = c(1, 
            0.5, 0.5,
            0.6, 0.4)
) %>% 
  mutate(person = factor(person,
                         levels = c("Mum", "Dad",
                                    "Both parents", "Paid childcare")),
         option = factor(option,
                         levels = paste("Option", 3:1)))

ggplot(df, aes(x = option, y = value, fill = person)) +
  geom_col() +
  scale_fill_brewer(palette = "Set1",
                    name = "") +
  theme_minimal() + 
  coord_flip() +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank()) +
  scale_y_reverse(labels = c("Start of/nyear",
                             "End of /nyear"),
                  breaks = 1:0)
```
